quote: ′Classic′ – a book which people praise and don’t read.
author: Mark Twain

quote: Sleep is good, he said, and books are better.
author: George R.R. Martin

quote: Books are the quietest and most constant of friends; they are the most accessible and wisest of counselors, and the most patient of teachers.
author: Charles W. Eliot

quote: Many people, myself among them, feel better at the mere sight of a book.
author: Jane Smiley

quote: The library is inhabited by spirits that come out of the pages at night.
author: Isabel Allende

quote: Take a good book to bed with you—books do not snore.
author: Thea Dorn

quote: If you don’t like to read, you haven’t found the right book.
author: J.K. Rowling

quote: One glance at a book and you hear the voice of another person, perhaps someone dead for 1,000 years. To read is to voyage through time.
author: Carl Sagan

quote: When I have a little money, I buy books; and if I have any left, I buy food and clothes.
author: Erasmus

quote: That’s the thing about books. They let you travel without moving your feet.
author: Jhumpa Lahiri

quote: A book is a version of the world. If you do not like it, ignore it; or offer your own version in return.
author: Salman Rushdie

quote: I love the smell of book ink in the morning.
author: Umberto Eco

quote: Rainy days should be spent at home with a cup of tea and a good book.
author: Bill Patterson

quote: Fairy tales are more than true: not because they tell us that dragons exist, but because they tell us that dragons can be beaten.
author: Neil Gaiman

quote: Where is human nature so weak as in the bookstore?
author: Henry Ward Beecher

quote: Books are good company, in sad times and happy times, for books are people – people who have managed to stay alive by hiding between the covers of a book.
author: E.B. White

quote: A book is a garden, an orchard, a storehouse, a party, a company by the way, a counselor, a multitude of counselors.
author: Charles Baudelaire

quote: A great book should leave you with many experiences, and slightly exhausted at the end. You live several lives while reading.
author: William Styron

quote: The America I love still exists at the front desks of our public libraries.
author: Kurt Vonnegut

quote: Books were my pass to personal freedom.
author: Oprah Winfrey

quote: A half-read book is a half-finished love affair.
author: David Mitchell

quote: I do believe something very magical can happen when you read a book.
author: J.K. Rowling

quote: The best books… are those that tell you what you know already.
author: George Orwell

quote: The worst thing about new books is that they keep us from reading the old ones.
author: Joseph Joubert
